intro: Cartrema marginata, commonly known as the marginated cartrema, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
